awd_titl_txt: Optical Test and Measurement Laboratory to Enhance          Electro-Optics Program
awd_abstract_narration: The Laser Electro-Optics Technology Department at Springfield                   Technical Community College (STCC) is enhancing its curriculum                  by acquiring an Optical Test & Measurement Lab with assistance                  from the National Science Foundation. The major instrument is                   the Zygo Mark IVxp Phase Measuring Interferometer.                              Interferometers have long been used for both macro and micro                    surface characterization in the fabrication and assembly of                     precision optical components and systems. The Zygo Mark IVxp                    Interferometer System represents the state-of-the-art in                        optical surface evaluation and is being used increasingly in a                  variety of measurement purposes in manufacturing and quality                    assurance. Access to such equipment by students is enriching                    the already diverse laser electro-optics offerings at STCC, one                 of but a handful of colleges in the country with a laser                        major.With the opportunity to engage in hands-on applications                   employing "real world" hardware in a laboratory setting, STCC                   students are being significantly better prepared to continue                    their studies at the university level and/or to pursue their                    technical careers in the private or government sectors.
